p: G. lucidum has been widely used in Asian regions to treat not only cancer but diabetes and neurasthenia as well. For the latter, the mushroom seems to have particularly beneficial effects, as demonstrated in a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial conducted by Tang et al. [ 108] with Ganopoly Â®. A total of 132 neurasthenic patients were randomized to receive placebo or 1800 mg three times daily for 8 weeks. At the end of treatment, patients taking G. lucidum were found to have an increased sense of well-being as measured by the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS), and consistent reductions in the Clinical Global Impression (CGI) severity scale score and fatigue.
